website_summaries.verdict: A versatile tripod with good adjustment features for those on a budget.
pros: Can hold camera in either landscape or portrait
Two bubble levels, an independent crank, and multiple tightening locations
cons: Carrying case does not have any padding

website_summaries.verdict: Low-priced travel tripod that works nicely for someone who has basic photography gear.
pros: Tripod only weighs 3 pounds, meaning you’ll be able to hike or travel with it easily
Has two bubble levels, allowing the photographer to balance the camera properly
Extends to 60 inches, which is an impressive height for a tripod with such a reasonable price point
Includes a carrying case for convenience
cons: Only supports a maximum weight of 6.6 pounds of camera gear, so it’s not made for large DSLR lenses

customer_reviews.title: As Perfect & Utilitarian As A Tripod Can Be!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this tripod. I have no clue how such a versatile tripod can go for so low...but hey just one more reason to LOVE Amazon.com!! As you can see I have no arms so I need a tripod that is lightweight but full on perks...this tripod is EVERYTHING I hoped for & then some!!!! It is VERY easy to operate from manipulating the height to changing the swivel points for various angles. The knobs are nice & big making screwing/unscrewing very easy & effortless. I got this for my Makayama iPad case & it works seamlessly with it. Great product! Great pricing!! Thanks Amazon!!!! [...]
customer_reviews.author: M. W. Trimble

customer_reviews.title: TOTALLY recomend it!
customer_reviews.text: As an "Intermediate" Photographer, testing the waters in professional/paid photography, I love this tripod! I do mostly nature, street, and portait shots, but I do occasionally do events and sports. This tripod is great for all of that! It allows me to get a slow enough ShutterSpeed, whether I'm in a lower lighting situation such as a party & don't want to crank up my ISO, or I am doing a landscape shot, and want very creamy, soft, movement. The tripod is very inexpensive- who wants to pay + for brands??? Very lightweight. Easy to transport (comes with a bag). It has so many features! Definitely recomend. I will let you guys know if my opinion on the tripod changes.
customer_reviews.author: Miller

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts make it hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an upgrade from the 50" Amazon basics tripod I mistakenly bought, that was too small to really handle a dslr with a big lens. When the 60" arrived, it had a few wear marks and was missing the quick attach mount. I'm pretty sure I ordered it new, so I'm unsure why it looks like I got an unchecked return. On a brighter note it does look like it would have been sturdy enough. It's also very light, so maybe you'll want to take a chance. I'm returning mine and probably buying one local.
customer_reviews.author: Firebird T/A

customer_reviews.title: Blech!
customer_reviews.text: worst tripod I ever experienced. You can not pan without shaky jerking movements. so light a small breeze can knock it down. I didn't expect much from the price and I got exactly that. I used as a 2nd camera support for a lecture I shot. If I didn't have the other tripod I would have been in big trouble. There is some good. quick release plate works ok. although light, with weights it compensated. I understand its a low end tripod but if it has an arm and tilts and pans. even a little roughness would be ok but this is really bad.
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: Defective item
customer_reviews.text: I brought it all the way to Alaska and wanted to shot the aurora but just found out it didn't function well! So furatrated! The bolt used to adjust the angle didn't work. I throw the item away. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: nemo

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, but didnt last
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this tripod just 5 months ago. I used it pretty regularly and always treated it well. Started falling apart by month 4 and noe its almost not even usable. It takes a lot for me to give a 1 star review. Height adjustment knob broke off, and 2 of the leg locks are broken.
customer_reviews.author: TX

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Portability: Like the carrying case for it. Everything is light weight and perfect to attach to my bag without the case as well. Structure: Light weight but sturdy enough to hold my camera. The ball swivel feet are great for rougher terrain or uneven surfaces. Functionality: The adjustable heights are great and easy to operate with the flip tabs. The "Portrait" and "Landscape" function is spot on for quick orientation changes. The bubble levels are easy to read and adds precision to the balance of the tripod; removes the guessing. The swivel action is smooth and doesn't stick so you can adjust the camera direction with ease. Overall I am happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Izumi JonesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works well until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: After 4 months of light use, one of the legs already has issues. The thing won't close around the leg and so that leg is always a bit off. Before this issue, it worked fine but issue with the leg started almost immediately after receiving it but finally became a bigger issue now.
customer_reviews.author: JasonL527

customer_reviews.title: Reviews are suspect!
customer_reviews.text: The reviews on this product is a little suspect. Without the camera the tilt function is abnormally loose. It can not tighten. Very cheaply made. I am too nervous to put anything on long. I may try to use it for one of my monitors or lights but it is certainly something that I will not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jerret

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginners or folks that just need something simple to hold their camera steady. I use my smartphone for filming and this is great at keeping it steady without breaking the bank. And at 60" tall, it's about the right height for matching up with my eye level. Check out my video review.
customer_reviews.author: Brighton West

customer_reviews.title: Hinge did not tighten all the way rendering the stand useless
customer_reviews.text: I had this replaced after the first one didn't work out because one of the hinges would not tighten all the way no matter how had I twisted the knob. I wasn't able to stabilize the camera as it would just loosen and tip lens first downwards. The replacement I was sent did the same exact thing.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dam

customer_reviews.title: Barely used it and it broke....
customer_reviews.text: I'm past the window when I can get technical support or a replacement, and yet, I've barely used it in the time I've had it and it already broke. The little handle that you use to screw the quick release plate into the camera or iphone stand completely came apart and now a major part of this tripod doesn't work. Really disappointed. It works fine otherwise. It's very light, so in some cases that's great, in others it's not because you loose some stability. The levers and whatnot work fine, but they're clearly low quality. Everything is just a bit "eh."
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the negative reviews saying that its just a flimsy plastic stand, I was pleasantly surprised after spending some time setting it up this afternoon. I found that it has some good features and it working for my portrait photo project. Theres many ways to adjust and tweak the stand until you get it right and it is very lightweight. I dont think its the best one best on the price point and that probably does reflect the quality overall, but i like it. Its basic and yet sturdy and cheap enough for beginners and gets the job done. Do recommend if you're not looking for anything extremely professional .
customer_reviews.author: Irena Azovsky

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod, but crappy materials lead to failure after 1-2 years in the leg clamps.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this tripod. I really like them but the clamps that hold the sliding legs fail too frequently. So it would be a five star rating, but crappy engineering or materials result in failure after awhile. I use these about 3 times a week to record videos of community events. So, seek a better quality tripod, or bite the bullet, use it, and prepare to have to purchase a replacement in 1-2 years. I think they are using substandard plastic that doesn't hold up long in the clamps.
customer_reviews.author: Vance Jochim

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: The last time I bought an inexpensive tripod was probably around 2002. I thought this one would be similar: it was the same price, after all. Not really: it is much lighter, and not as robust. For example, the way the feet are attached is simply a press fit. Somehow I managed to lose one in the first two weeks. It functions OK. It does what it says it does. But if you are going to use a tripod with any kind of regularity, or travel with it to any extent, I would suggest spending even a little bit more money and getting a more robust tripod.
customer_reviews.author: TIMOTHY MASSEY

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a basic tripod
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a basic tripod to use with my Cannon EOS R and I decided to buy this one because it had good reviews and is sold at a good price. I was a little confused at first trying to figure out how to use all the tilt adjustments but I went back to the product page and found a video showing how to use the tripod adjustments, now I'm no longer confused! :) Overall I think this tripod is great for the price and it does everything I need it to do as a somewhat beginner photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a real piece of junk. I bought it solely for using with a small laser level that weighs way less than most any camera. I assumed any tripod would be able to handle that, as it should. The adjustment knob for the tilt can't get tight enough to hold it sturdy even when it's wrenched all the way down. Maybe I received a defective one. I initiated a return but forgot to drop it in the mail and now it's outside of the return window. Absolute waste of money, not useful for anything and too large for a paperweight. I wonder how many of these are in the landfill already.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good; light-weight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for over a year and it works superwell. Good for the price. It is stable and can handle my camera, Canon EOS 7D with a mic on. Easy adjustable and easy to carry around as it is light-weight. It is smooth with horizontal pans for videos. Id be a little carefull with it if pointing camera straight up or straight down, particularly if your camera is heavy, just in case, but i have never had an issue. I have two, and have had no issue with either one. Ive used them on uneven surfaces, outside and for photo and film and it works absolutely great!
customer_reviews.author: Runa S.

customer_reviews.title: GOOD!
customer_reviews.text: Overall I say this little tripod is a great deal! I am sure you can get something better, but at the PRICE it has worked well for us. We have had it now for two years and it is in great shape still. Extremely light weight and, although it might not be the most compact, I still think it is pretty compact in general. We've had our car packed to the brim and have always still found a place to slide this in. Easy to use and perfect if your looking for something to allow you to point and click. A good, basic, tripod.
customer_reviews.author: J. Costanzo

customer_reviews.title: Came broken ! Whyyyyy
customer_reviews.text: It came Broken and I had it shipped to Trinidad 🇹🇹 for an event I needed it for 😢😢😢😢 . To send it back to the States then wait for a new one too expensive and I didnt have enough time !!! So heart broken ... whyyyyyy whyyyyyy !!!!! The actual product is wonderful made , nice carry bag . This hurts sooo badly 😢😢
customer_reviews.author: judai

customer_reviews.title: Adequate for most general uses. A basic tripod for basic use.
customer_reviews.text: Tripod received appears to be adequate and should function sufficiently if handled with care. The Plastic used for this product seems hard, giving the impression it might snap easily at some point. Only time will tell. The head rotates stiffly and and will likely not provide a smooth pan for video use, probably o.k for stills. Head is taut but not stiff when fully extended and may create shaking in a wind or when handling device. The tripod is lightweight and otherwise appears stable. It should be adequate for most general uses. It is a basic tripod for basic use.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Pappy

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy for a spotting scope
customer_reviews.text: This at first seemed like a good tripod. It's easily adjustable, and the head allows for easy maneuvering of the spotting scope. But it's just not rigid enough to dampen vibrations, so it doesn't hold the scope still enough for good viewing. For the price, I guess I shouldn't have expected more. But if you want a good tripod for viewing wildlife through a scope, pay more and get something more solid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to use, but no instruction manual.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great piece. While I have nothing to compare it to, it's very easy to use, even for a beginner like myself. It's got SO many levels and knobs on it, so you can always make sure you have a level shot. My only complaint is that it didn't come with any instructions, so using it was trial and error, although it's fairly straight forward. I'm not sure if none of them come with instructions or if it was just mine, but it would still be helpful, in the event that there are some features I'm missing out on. Can't beat the price, and it serves its purpose for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Not the highest Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is not a top quality fully, 360 degrees on 3 axis tripod, but it is basic, and will get the job done, It had good reviews. It is basically sturdy and the materials are good quality. It is not able to fully adjust the level of the camera. Hence a 1 star deduction. The big draw back is, you have to remove the mounting platform to screw the tripod to the camera. A rather stupid design. But for the price, it will hold the camera still But will still bend and twist when the shutter button is depressed. Good basic tripod for the money and is most likely much better than others in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Received two broken tripods before getting a non-broken one...may not last long. Glad theres a year warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Third times a charm! I received two broken tripods with nuts and pieces falling off, very frustrating. However, the tripod seemed to be a decent quality for the price with a year warranty, so I gave it one more chance. Finally on the third one, it was in a plastic bag and in perfect condition. I do really like it. Its my first tripod and seems to do the job well and has a ton of movement features. It just took so long to get it right, Im a little concerned about the longevity of the item.
customer_reviews.author: liekfam4

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, esp 4 the money
customer_reviews.text: 2 perfectly placed level bubbles; perfect telescoping legs and clamps; perfect, bodacious hardware, cranks and knobs; generous, extra-long column for (yes, perfect) final crank height; perfect, beautiful metal finish; perfect, thoughtful, swivel feet pads (do not drag or bounce); perfect collapsible size and weight; remember not to over-crank (perfectly) designed knobs. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: JACK KEDZIE

customer_reviews.title: Great value.  Perfect for traveling.
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous tripod. I own an expensive, heavy, multiple function tripod, however I was going on a trip to Finland to try and photograph the Northern Lights and didn't want to hassle with my standard tripod. Purchased this one looking for something light weight that I could take on the trip. Didn't expect much due to the cost and was extremely, pleasantly surprised. Great little, light weight, full size tripod. Fit diagonally in my checked luggage and didn't put me over my baggage limits. Strong and durable enough to hold my Nikon D7200 with a large lens without losing its position. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Sebring

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I liked this tripod, very lightweight and sleek looking. However, the one of the clasps that holds a leg in place was only held in by a very thin, cheap part that broke within 2 months. It still works, but the leg falls out and has to be mounted delicately. I didn't expect much, considering the price. Still, would have been nice to get more than just 2 months out of the thing.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Schwandt

customer_reviews.title: Great! Don't let the price fool you.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a temporary tripod because my expensive, PRO tripod I use with my Nikon SLR broke. Nope, I am still using this nice and low priced tripod. Amazon has this great way of taking expensive items, like shredders or in this case the tripod, and calling it AmazonBasics. Well, they do a fine job at it. Yes, these are essential items and they are great! Eventually I might get another Benro S7 like I had before; however, this low-priced tripod from Amazon is getting the job done for now. I trust it with my Nikon DSLR D6 and that is saying a lot. Not to mention the lens. Good stuff! Thanks Amazon for making things low-priced.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Wheeler, Attorney At Law

customer_reviews.title: Not a rip-off. Great for it's intended purpose
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly serviceable for lightweight cameras or for smartphones with the addition of an inexpensive smartphone mount. Should work well with consumer-level SLRs like the Canon Rebel. Not suitable for heavy professional cameras, and the pros/advanced anateurs who have complained about its unsuitability for this purpose frankly should know better. What were they thinking? I do not use this tripod in my studio with my three-pound (with lenses and accessories) professional digital SLR. If you're a casual shooter or want to steady a smartphone for good quality photos and video, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott VanDeman

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC TRIPOD
customer_reviews.text: I was given an older metal tripod that I have since misplaced. I got a new iPad for Christmas for videoing my sons hockey games and I would get tired holding my arms up in the air trying to film over the glass. This makes everything so much simpler! I love it. So many little tweaks and adjustments that will ensure it sits just right. Definitely worth buying!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Barber

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain that looks great. This is what you want to buy!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Fits my spotting scope at the outdoor range but much more cheaper and this looks like professional quality use. Great price point and has many features. Many reviews displaying cracking may be caused by user over tightening. It is plastic meeting aluminum parts so treat this a bit fragile and not good for bouncing around or loading heaving things on top. If you treat your camera or spotting scope delicately then this is just an extension of that and has to be used in the same fashion. I enjoy this at the range and people always ask me where did I get it and for how much
customer_reviews.author: Gone247

customer_reviews.title: This thing is biger than I thought it would be when folded up.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality yet a little flimsy due to how light weight it is. For the price though I would not mind it much if it was broken. You will want to pass on this tripod if your rig weighs more than 10lbs though as it feels like the legs would buckle under a good load. So if you have something in the weight range of an old VHS Brick-camcorder I would not trust in this to support it. As for the top clamp not holding the load and swiveling on it's own, get some paper and shove it in between the clamping surfaces. That will add more friction to the clamp and keep it from drooping when tightened.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Logitech webcam compatible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tripod so I would have more options for using my Logitech webcam for online interfacing. I was not certain the base of the Logitech 920 would be compatible with this tripod, but it is 100%. The base of the webcam accepts the bolt on the tripod mounting plate perfectly. And there is a quick release feature on the tripod to ensure the webcam won't tip off when you move the unit around. Perhaps the less expensive tripod Amazon sells would also have worked, but I did not try that one - just went for this one because of the high reviews.
customer_reviews.author: JennyG

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This tripod is very light weight, perfect for birding outings where a heavier tripod would be tiring, awkward and cumbersome. It is sturdy enough for a camera with a 75-300mm telephoto lens, but may not be heavy/sturdy enough, or have enough mass for a very long telephoto lens and camera. It has a carrying handle, adjustments for lateral rotation, vertical rotation, elevation, and a mount that attaches to the base of the camera or lens and allows for a quick connect/disconnect. There are three telescoping segments to each of the three legs that lock securely.
customer_reviews.author: k4zmb

customer_reviews.title: Awesome adjustability
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tripod for the price. Folds up easily and is very compact. The locking mechanisms for the legs wont handle rough use and seem to be a little on the cheap side, but at this price point its more than adequate. The adjustability is very nice and will easily stay in any position. It comes with a nylon carrying case with large zippers that seems well constructed. There were no instructions included, at least in my package, so it took a little bit to discover some adjustments. Overall, I believe, you wont be disappointed in this purchase and will fit any camera with a mounting screw or gopro.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod for my projector
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to use with my projector to watch movies on my deck. The initial connection between the tripod and projector was very unstable. So, I made my own adapter using a wooden block, 1/4” nut, Velcro pads. 15 minute job. Once assembled everything worked fine. No more boxes to use as stands. Great value and my movie nights now look very high end!
customer_reviews.author: Cigar Dave

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with heavy binoculars, Celestron SkyMaster Giant 15x70 Binoculars with Tripod Adapter. The adapter that came with the binoculars worked perfectly in this tripod. I am thrilled with the lightweight of it and the ease of using it at various heights. It comes with an easy to use carry case and even has a little hook on the tripod for the case when not in use. It is easy to manipulate into different viewing angles It did not come with instructions, so you have to figure out how to adjust the heights, but after a couple of minutes, it became obvious. Well worth the money if using with a heavy device.
customer_reviews.author: Esaud1

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs - basic and functional
customer_reviews.text: I'm just a mom who likes to take photos so I didn't need anything fancy but wanted a tripod on hand for those occasions when we want everyone in the picture. This is inexpensive, easy to use, folds up nicely and is super light weight. You could even just throw it in the bottom of your stroller to take with you on various little excursions so you could ensure you always had a picture with the kids instead of always being behind the camera. I'm sure it would work well for professional photographers too. If you just need a tripod that's functional, this one will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Short-term solution, locking mechanisms wear out pretty quickly
customer_reviews.text: I have a 70's tripod that is entirely metal parts, which continues to function well. However, it is heavier than the modern plastic & aluminum ones (like this product), so I thought to try out an Amazon Suggested product. Not that impressive since the key features of locking it into place fail to work within a year. The weak spots on the tripod are hard to overcome with glues, tape, adding new bolts, etc., because the design is not well tested for failure (evidently). Not recommended unless you only need it for a year, then will trash it.
customer_reviews.author: David Jackemeyer

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: Previously I had ordered another version of the amazon essentials camera tri-pod and it was okay, but easily had broken. So I decided to give it another shot and ordered this one. So far I am very pleased and this one seems to be much sturdier without a huge weight difference from the one I previously had. So far zero complaints. It seems to work for my Nikon d3500 perfectly and also for my smaller canon as well as my phone. It doesn’t come with a phone attachment piece, but those are easily found for cheap and I already had one also. It it easily adjusted and folds up and down easily.
customer_reviews.author: aubrinam

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy - Not for Heavy, Rugged Use - Feels Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Very light-weight and the plastic "locking" mechanisms do not seem like they will hold up under normal conditions ... time will tell but I suspect that this unit will have to go back to Amazon. I could be wrong but these are my first impressions. The "Bubble-Level" is very hard to see. If you need something "more reliable" ... this product may not be what you are looking for. If you are going to set it up and leave it in one place ... maybe this will work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Scuba S

customer_reviews.title: Good basic tripod for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a lightweight tripod, good for basic stability. The fittings and hinges are mostly plastic, but it works well if you don't treat it like some heavy duty A/V tripod. I use mine for a shooting chronograph, and for that application it's perfect, it holds the chronograph in place at the height and position I need it, and it's light weight makes it easy to carry to my gun club's rifle range. If I were a serious photographer or something, I'd definitely get a better tripod than this, but for the price, and my needs it was a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W.

customer_reviews.title: Requires additional piece if using for cell phone.
customer_reviews.text: I made this purchase fairly quickly. Upon arrival I couldn’t figure out how to attach this to my phone. I was looking for other reviews similar to mine and couldn’t find too many because most people are using this tripod to mount digital cameras 📷. You must purchase an additional piece separately to be able to mount your phone. I have an iPhone 11+. It works.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Initally Skeptical, Not Anymore
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a not-so-expensive and well-made tripod to hold my Canon EOS 60D for university courses. I browsed and browsed and came across this one by Amazon, initially skeptical because of low-price but still purchased due to good reviews. I've been using it for four months and it has yet to let me down! It holds my heavy camera four feet above the ground, the material is sturdy/tough, it comes with a balance bubble (I forget what it's actually called), and so long as you use some common sense you'll be able to set it up safely and quickly.
customer_reviews.author: LeCario Benashley

customer_reviews.title: A good, basic tripod -- but it won't support a camera with a zoom lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, inexpensive tripod that works very well when the photographer is using the camera hands-on. However, if you want to set up a shot and step away, the camera will droop if you have even a modest zoom lens attached. The tripod cannot handle the torque on its own. So if what you want is something that will help steady your picture, this will work well. But if you want to use it with a heavy camera and/or zoom lens, I recommend purchasing a more substantial tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Randall G.

customer_reviews.title: great inexpensive tripod!
customer_reviews.text: this is a great inexpensive tripod. I was looking to spend $150-200 for a better tripod. I could not decide all the reviews had problems, so I decided to take a chance on this tripod until I decide what I really want in a tripod. So happy I bought this one. It has been great and just was I needed for now. If you need a tripod don't hesitate to buy this one, it is good enough for now and holds my spotting scope and my Nikon DX5000 with zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Rickey  B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Travel & Regular Use Tri-Pod!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to use. I have never had any problems with my AmazonBasics Tri-Pod. It is very easy to use, comes with a travel bag, and is super lightweight. It comes with a hook if you need to ut a weight on it during windy days and it also has a level to get your photos or videos super straight. As it is 60 inches you can get really tall shots if need be. I have been using it for about a year now and I love it. It does everything a tri-pod is supposed to do without any of the extra fuss. Great for Travel!
customer_reviews.author: seoulfull

customer_reviews.title: It is a bit wobbly
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these, and one has this problem more than the other. The connection between the tripod and central element is a bit loose and allows the central pole to shift around a bit. Also, the central column isn't perfectly steady when raised either, even when tightened down, so it wobbles a bit too. I didn't expect perfection for the price, but I have gotten significantly sturdier tripods at this same price, and the inconsistent build quality between the two Amazon Basics tripods suggests that there is room for improvement.
customer_reviews.author: This User

customer_reviews.title: disappointingly jerky when panning
customer_reviews.text: With the light weight, I didn't expect this tripod to be particularly stable, and it wasn't. The real disappoint is with the lack of smoothness when panning or changing elevation angle. It sticks, then releases regardless of the friction setting on the adjustment knobs. I've tried lubricating it, but I haven't been able to disassemble the head to do that properly. Customer support was almost worthless, although after much research they recommend a lubricant (silicon). Don't expect a manual or exploded view diagram (hey, at least they didn't laugh at me during either of my separate calls). It's a cheap POS, just don't expect anything else. I like the light weight when I have to carry it walking or bicycling.
customer_reviews.author: DOVA

customer_reviews.title: Holds a 35mm SLR without swaying or tipping
customer_reviews.text: I am a photographer and I was surprised by this tripod. It is very well made, has the necessary elements for adjustment, quick mount and great height. For the price it really cannot be beat. Would I use it on a professional shoot? Probably never. I will use it for vacationing and for the cell phone use. It is light weight and easily will pack in a carry-on bag. It is sturdy enough to hold a 35mm SLR without swaying or tipping. The plastic gears though do not warrant the trust for a $2K camera.
customer_reviews.author: Woody1

customer_reviews.title: Not good for video. Ok for cameras.
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Gets the job done on the cheap if you’re doing photography. I like the quick detach mechanism, the grip, and the leveling bumble. Aluminum and plastic. A good deal for the price. CONS: If you at shooting video, Do not bother with these! If you intend to shoot video where you need to pan the shot to the sides, the swivel heads on these tripods are horrible because they produce chatter in the side to side motion. It is just not smooth. I got a horrible chatter / vibration in my video. Also, if you will be shooting around people, it’s so lightweight that a small touch can shake the whole stand. Not good for video.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Great value tripod for an amateur!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first tripod so I can’t compare to other more expensive ones. I’m an amateur photographer and this met my needs very well. Taking videos, selfies, group photos it’s been great so far. It is very easy to carry in its bag, it’s lightweight, very easy to adjust height/angles, extend legs and change positions. Stability is good too! Overall I am very satisfied with it for my purposes. If you are like me don’t hesitate to give this Amazon product a try. I’m giving it 5 stars because for the price it met all my expectations with flying colors so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaddict

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tripod! It's an amazing price... Since it's so cheap, I really did not think it was going to be that good. But I've used it multiple times now, and it has worked amazingly every time. It has been very sturdy, extremely light weight, and it comes with a carrying case which really comes in handy. Plus, the height is really just perfect! I have multiple cameras and for the price, there really isn't a better tripod for the job. Especially if you're just starting out with photography or just need a basic tripod that will get the job done, then this is definitely the best option out there.
customer_reviews.author: Jeta

customer_reviews.title: Bargain buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tripod. I am very satisfied with its ease of use and portability. I especially like that it seems very well made and not cheap generic like product. I have bought an inexpensive tripod in past that was a cheap walmart special but it was terrible. Was worthless. This however is wonderful. Im sure there are more expensive higher end products that are stronger heavier and just heavy duty for bulky super zoom lenses but this item is more than enough for me. It can easily support my canon dslr and lenses. Also the carry bag is very durable. All around great product. Its a bargain! I use this for Photography and video shoots.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.text: It's not the best but for the purpose I bought it for which was aim toward my young kids aged 11 and 9 it's perfect. It provides them the necessary fun factor to use and you don't have to worry about them roughing it up and breaking it. This is a pretty tough tripod from the tripods that I have used. I have another one which I have my older kids using which is a little bit more delicate and expensive. This one provides just enough that I don't have to worry and I have piece of mind. I'm so satisfied this did not cost a fortune.
customer_reviews.author: Shafqatullah Syed

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and usable tripod within weight limits
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with this tripod. Extends easily and stable once locked down. Not for heavy cameras with mega lenses, or meant for heavy work, not a top of the line pro tripod, but it's 25 bucks, not 700. Very usable for the average enthusiasts, or as a light stand etc. It holds my pentax k3, with a tamron 70-200 lens quite well, wouldn't push it much farther. Buy it for what it is, and you'll be happy, might get another just to toss in the trunk in case. Pleased. PS: the removable base can be put on in any direction, helps avoid confusion.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Wickham

customer_reviews.title: Very good basic stand
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these before and ended up giving it to my nephew for his photography, because of covid ... I got into online streaming and it was just easier to use my phone to stream content rather than setting up OBD studio and extra stuff on my laptop ... So I got back another one of these stands ... For the price and functionality ... It is really good ... and it doesn't feel cheaply made ... I'll admit ... I'd stay away from the smaller variant of this model ... but this one is pretty good
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: I was debating to purchase this product due to some negative reviews on YouTube. I bought many tripods from eBay and other online retailers. They all look great and even work great for a few weeks and then everything starts falling apart. I was a little skeptical about buying this however I decided to give it a shot and it was a great decision. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed A Wajiuddin

customer_reviews.title: I love this tripod.
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my online art class business and use it almost daily. This is the best tripod I've ever had. It is easy to use, has a handle to carry plus the case, I can use my phone in any orientation, the legs expand instantly. Cannot say enough great things about this. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: grammyslg

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod
customer_reviews.text: I have a plein air easel that I purchased that came with a tripod to support it. The original tripod broke so I replaced it with this one. This tripod is more sturdy than the original and more stable. Once the easel angles and height is set, it stays put. I like the addition of the hook on the center post that allows me to put some weight in the carry bag to keep it standing in wind. I have not yet tested it outside, but it has been great for working on small paintings in the studio.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie N

customer_reviews.title: item nicer looking than pic and seems sturdy enough for all my needs
customer_reviews.text: Clean lines, item nicer looking than pic and seems sturdy enough for all my needs. Like the twin bubbles (a selling point for me) and I imagine it will break in nicely with some use-would rather have some stiff at start than slop 'n flop. Fits my FZ30 and the 35mm just fine and should go all the way w/my med. format S1000. The weight hook's a handy touch I WILL need it at times due to some of the locales I shoot (beaches, wilderness & mtns.). It will be tested at these times of need. Great for the price. Works so far with the testing shots around here. Arrived as promised as usual. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Silvia

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly great!
customer_reviews.text: This thing surprised me considering how cheap it was. I had my expectations low, but was rather surprised at it when I set it up. All the adjustments you need and quality hardware. Typically things like this the lock mechanisms/switches etc are junk, but this thing is solid. Really nice sturdy tripod!
customer_reviews.author: AA-Ron

customer_reviews.title: It's exactly what i needed
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tripod. It has a good, wide base when the legs are extended to make it a very sturdy, stable tripod. It has a level on it so you can make sure your camera or smart phone is taking a very level video. It's got a nice carrying case that is very light weight for easy storage and carrying it to those hard to get to places. I like it. I can't wait to put this tripod to use in making my YouTube videos for The Fitness Experiment. This is a tripod I can easily recommend. Get one. You'll love it too.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Roth

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the quality of this item. I was expecting something cheaply made, to use in the interim only to have to be replaced with a more expensive item later, but was pleased when it came in. No replacement needed. Used several times already, all the mechanisms work seamlessly so far. May have to lubricate some the telescoping mechanics later, but user maintenance is expected. Easily attached my cannon, and my recently purchased movo smart phone video kit. Will be looking for more amazon basics if this is the kind of product they are going to put out.
customer_reviews.author: C. Holguin

customer_reviews.title: Great Tripod
customer_reviews.text: I'm starting to really like Amazon Basics! My husband bought me this tripod for my camera and it is incredibly easy to assemble and disassemble. It also has many different settings and has the ability to be as tall or as short as you need it to be. It is made of very sturdy and durable material and comes with a very convenient carrying case for you to pack it up and carry it with you! I ended up buying one for my mom and one for my sister after receiving mine! Would definitely recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tripod for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my best friend who needed a tripod for his iPad and recording equipment. He let me borrow it for my Nikon D7100. This is a great tripod for the price. I love that it has a removable platform to allow you to easily remove and replace your camera on the tripod. It easily rotates with 360 degree turns. It is lightweight and when I add it to my camera bag it is not uncomfortable to travel with. The middle hook allows for a sandbag to be place to prevent wobbling. I would recommend this for anyone looking for an affordable tripod that can do what the more expensive ones are capable of doing.
customer_reviews.author: dtate001

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tripod, don't get me wrong here. Great features, height, easy to use. I shoot video and it's NOT good for panning (left and right). It will give you a jerky inconsistent motion. Pros = Great for photography Cons = No good for videos when panning left or right
customer_reviews.author: FN-2187

customer_reviews.title: It comes in a durable cloth-like carry bag that makes it easy to store
customer_reviews.text: The description describes it perfectly. It comes in a durable cloth-like carry bag that makes it easy to store. As of now it absolutely fits all of my current needs as an amateur photographer. As I learn more advanced techniques or use heavier cameras, I may upgrade. As for now, this is perfect for my current camera which weighs around 1.8 pounds and phone. It is my first tripod. I do not remember using any instructions, but it was effortless to figure out and incredibly sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: EPG

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply-constructed. One leg fell apart after a dozen uses.
customer_reviews.text: This light-weight tripod soon became useless after being used perhaps a dozen times. One lower leg latch loosened, and, after a couple of hours of trying to repair it, can only be held together with something like duct tape. This necessitates keeping that one leg permanently opened; the storage bag is now useless, too. Yuck.
customer_reviews.author: MarkB

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and fully adjustable. Easily attaches to my backpack when hiking and light enough that it hardly seems like it is there. Comes with a quick release plate that attaches to the camera body (or lens mount) and makes it quicker to set-up on the tri-pod. The down side to this set-up is if you change between the camera body and a lens mount, you will need to remove the plate from the camera body and install it on the lens. If you use you camera with multiple lenses (that use a mount), go ahead save yourself the headache and order extra quick release plates to use on each of these items.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Dart

customer_reviews.title: Solid Support
customer_reviews.text: I've used mine to hold a small camera (no surprise it is great for that) and also to hold a large Square netted Brass Catcher when I am at the Pistol Range. The adjustability of the tripod allows me to use it on the Range Bench or when I go to an outdoor range, I can extend the legs and crank up the pedestal and use it while standing. It comes with a hook on the bottom that allows for adding stabilizing weight for the windy days we get here in the Texas Panhandle.
customer_reviews.author: M. Timmons

customer_reviews.title: It's nice for the price you pay!
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this 4 stars overall. The tripod itself is nice. I took family photos with it I had it in the grass which was fine, but I wouldn't trust it anywhere near concrete especially if you have a nice camera. For the price you can't really beat it. Overall its a good tripod. I mainly use it to film youtube videos in my house!
customer_reviews.author: Crissanna Parker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect with my D750
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with my Nikon D750. I don't understand many reviewers being high and mighty and saying that you need to spend a lot of money on a tripod if you spent a lot of money on your camera. I took this thing backpacking Europe and used it many times on rough, uneven, wet terrain. It was perfect. It's very light, which is perfect for travel, so I'd just be cautious if you're ever using it in windy conditions because it could be at risk of blowing over when you've got your camera mounted on it.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Turner

customer_reviews.title: Great little tripod but has issues
customer_reviews.text: Only problem is the screw to attach the camera is too short. Looking for a different mount for this. I ended up making a bracket to compensate for the short screw. Device has to be offset from center a bit but it works. Manufacturer really needs to address this issue. Would be simple to make it so the screw is NOT captured or to provide a an additional mount to account for devices which may require the longer screw. This product would have received 5 stars from me if not for that simple issue.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Gourley

customer_reviews.title: If I ever get into photography I would buy this
customer_reviews.text: I have bought other amazon basics product before mostly HDMI cables and what not but decided to buy this for a friend as he is learning photography and needed a tripod for those cool steady shoots that he needed. He loves it! He told me this feels like a product that is a lot more expensive than what it actually is and I agree with him Pros Excellent build quality Easy adjustable head Premium customer service as amazon is Cons None
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Serrano

customer_reviews.title: Decent tall tripod
customer_reviews.text: Felt sturdy and stable yet lightweight for a full-sized tripod. I got it because of the two levels on the tripod head, but ultimately decided to return it because it is still too big and heavy for my purposes of traveling and hiking to take long-exposure landscape or astrophotography. It would be too much for me to carry even with my camera backpack having a specific design for carrying tripods. I got the smaller 50-in tripod instead and that one is much lighter and easier to carry.
customer_reviews.author: X-Sparker

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed by the build qualtiy!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I've bought many tripods in the past but this is probably the best you'll get at this price point. The legs of the tripod feel sturdy, and the grips feel durable. It doesn't wobble at all! The screw that attaches to your camera/microphone has a removable mount for easy access. Everything on this tripod feels well thought out and carefully engineered. The plastic parts don't feel cheap and amazon uses metal pieces where its needed. It doesn't feel too heavy when carrying around! (Although I'm not really going anywhere)
customer_reviews.author: Byron

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and folds up compactly
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to mount my VR headset sensors on. They would work great for a camera too. They fold up very compactly, come with a carrying case, and are easy to set up. There are two adjustable leg lengths, as well as a crank to get the tripod up to the 60". There is a quick release mount so you can mount the camera or device without having to maneuver around with the tripod. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: BMac

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Light
customer_reviews.text: What I definitely needs was a LIGHT tripod. And it's definitely light. Won;t hurt my back if I carry it out into the wilderness. Unfortunately, I was looking for a video tripod, which Amazon tricked me and told me this was... it isn't tho'. You can't really pan on this without looking jerky. Anyways, it's much better than my old photography tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Kandice K. Zimbleman-Wang

customer_reviews.title: Quite Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure how this would hold up since other photographers spend way more on their tripods, as someone starting out this seems to get the job done, although with all of the legs out it does seem to be a bit uneven so I slightly have to make 2 of the other legs lower for it to be balanced which may just be a slight flaw in mine. I use this for real estate photography and have not had any issues other than the above, I like that it has a center column so I can adjust the height without having to adjust the legs of the tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Really decent tripod but not amazingly smooth operation.
customer_reviews.text: WOW man these things rock. I had my Canon t2i attached i had a light and mic on it. Then i had my bag underneath with 2 cameras 10 batteries and other misc items and the handle and tripod was perfect no bending or flexing ONLY ONE minor flaw the pan and tilt IS NOT SMOOTH at all even with my sony handy cam it was not fluid in anyway even when completely lose it was stuttering while moving it. Maybe some lube would help but still for the price a nice tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Darth Fader Productions

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tripod for the $17.59 I paid
customer_reviews.text: Sure there are better tripods out there but you won't beat this one for construction and features for what I paid. I hung a 3 lb weight plate from the bottom hook for added stability and I couldn't be more pleased. I use it for taking pictures of merchandise to sell on ebay and it's perfect for that purpose. BTW the Velbon QB-4W Quick Release Platforms that fit this tripod can be had from ebay for $1.79 each. Top measurement is 66mm X 52mm, slightly larger than the original Amazon one but the measurement that counts is the bottom one which is an exact match of 44mm X 44mm.
customer_reviews.author: Raymod J Archibald

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny (and then some!)
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, better than any ~$20-something dollar item has any right to be. Others have gone into exhaustive reviews, so really just here to pad the stats: sturdy/well constructed (i.e. pieces fit together well), very adjustable, lots of small "nice" features (directional feet with rubber boots to dampen vibrations, weight hook, etc). It's north of 3 pounds, so at least 1-1.5 pounds heavier than "ultralight" tripods that are literally 10x the price (~$200+). Will update the review if this happens to break at some point, but I'd be very surprised. [Note: it can SEEM wobbly if you don't tighten things down, in particular the vertical extender.]
customer_reviews.author: Trevor C

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I am actually really impressed with this tripod. This is my second tripod I’ve owned so I haven’t been through a bunch but I can honestly say so far I’m impressed. The material doesn’t feel cheap, it’s not too heavy and not too light so you can carry it around without feeling like you’re working out and it can hold up a DSLR without feeling like the tripod will give out. So far I’m having no issues with anything. The legs stay in place and I feel comfortable with it holding my $3000 camera. I’d definitely recommend to anyone needing a tripod.
customer_reviews.author: brittany

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This product is very lightweight, but it’s also seems very fragile. I’m using it for an indoor setup so it’ll be hiding for what I need. If there’s a potential chance that something could knock into it, I wouldn’t purchase this tripod. The only other thing that is kind of a pain is the plate is difficult to put in if you want to switch the direction of the retention pin. Overall, this product is great for what I need it for. I just caution those who plan on beating up the tripod a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted!
customer_reviews.text: This little tripod lasted me about a year. Worked really great for my Cannon with standard sized lens attachments. Was comfortable to lug around when hiking out in the woods or in the city. Easy to use. Recently bought a large ef 300 mm lens that may have been to heavy for it. The tripod attached directly to the lens and the plastic nobs that tighten down the unit wore out quickly soon after.. I could have over tightened but better safe than sorry with this lens!!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Has a number of good features including the price
customer_reviews.text: Has a number of good features including the price, but unfortunately the swivel from left to right is sticky & as I bought this to film boxing matches I have found it incredibly frustrating to use.I have tried to free up the action unsuccessfuly, does anybody out there know how to fix this? The other compaint I have is that Amazon gave the packaging size accurately but then put the box inside a larger box & as I live in New Zealand the freight cost me an arm & leg, far far higher than I expected
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about the negative reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I can't say if the bad reviews are from people who just don't understand how to work the tripod or if I just got lucky. However, I have found this tripod to be very light and sturdy. I have had no issues with it supporting the weight of my camera and lens with no wobble.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Miles

customer_reviews.title: Light, easy and dependable tripod!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very lightweight and extremely easy to adjust tripod. Simply flip the clips to adjust--even on uneven terrain. It's easy to carry with the handle and adjusts up and down in a half dozen ways. I love that it has two levels built in as well as a quick-disconnect shoe, which is invaluable. The last tripod I bought and used for magazine articles and pictures was heavy and clumsy to handle. I purchased this one for pictures for a craft book. It is so easy to use and adjust!
customer_reviews.author: Jolene

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased this tripod three years ago for casual use as a photo hobbiest. Since the pandemic it has come into much more vigorous use. Every day it seems I am finding something else the tripod is able to do. I have a couple other tripods that are gathering dust. This one is my go to tool for taking pictures, and virtual meetings as well. It easily accepts tablet and phone holders too. I don’t think I will ever need another one as it is so adaptable to any situation indoors or out!
customer_reviews.author: codyecho

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - piece broke in less than 24 hours.
customer_reviews.text: My son just received and put it together yesterday. TODAY the part holding the webcam popped off and broke. I wanted to send it back but he said it wasn’t worth the effort as it was cheap — well buyer beware when something is cheap — and he could “make it work”. So he just switched out webcams and used tape. Completely disappointed in this piece of equipment. He does streaming online so it was in one place so it wasn’t like it was being moved around even.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Shipped without needed parts
customer_reviews.text: Product was received damaged. The handle is bend but still does work. I also did not receive the adapter plate with the 1/4 stud out of the top. Was using on a cabinet project and needed alittle taller stand, well im out $$$ and i dont feel like driving 30 miles back to town to return this tripod. Legs work great but the top assembly is complete garbage. Im honest not worried about returning just wish it come with the parts i ordered it for:/.
customer_reviews.author: MR_TAZ

customer_reviews.title: Small Footprint Is AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tripod as I needed slightly more height than the tripod I had been using. First off the quality and features are first rate. The double built in levels are a nice touch and the parts fit, handles, gears, plate lever are really nice. The best feature for me however, is the nice small footprint. I use this to hold my video camera for bench work and the distance between legs when they are full extended is 30" (my old tripod was (43"). This means I can tuck the tripod up closed to the bench which I love. I am TOTALLY pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: great starter tripod
customer_reviews.text: The good: like it, gets the job done, everything works just fine, all types of dimensional changes possible, even has a hook to hang weights, the camera snaps in and out very quickly,. The bad: not a lot, it feels a little flimsy, not really the best quality, so I wouldn't rely on it for heavy duty use. overall: if you're like me and just need the occasional tripod to get your long exposure shots every once in a while, this is perfect for the price, but if you're going to be using it all the time, I would go with a more expensive/more heavy duty choice.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: It's fine for casual use but it's not sturdy enough to ...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. It's fine for casual use but it's not sturdy enough to withstand travel. The plastic grip broke before even the first use - no big deal since its really light and you dont need it. Then the wind knocked the tripod over (which is a really possibility considering how light it is) and one of the leg extensions broke. Finally, its really prone to dust and after a week the legs and center arm would not collapse or extend smoothly. Bottom line - if you need it once in a while for family events and indoor functions, no problem. If you need a rugged travel companion, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: hari-bhari

customer_reviews.title: What a surprise! This is a terrific Tripos for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I have a tripod and accidentally ordered this. I was going to just return it when it arrived, but I opened it to take a look. Wow! I'm tossing my old cheap tripod! This on is so incredibly adjustable, even has a built-in level, a carrying bag, and works with both my iphone and my Nikon! It's so light and portable! Maybe not great if you shot in wind storms or war, but it really does the trick for talking heads and volleyball games. I'm so happy with this purchase. I will update if it falls apart, but for now, I am in love. Tripods have come a long way.
customer_reviews.author: Van McQueen

customer_reviews.title: Rivet Fell Out in Three Months of Light Use.
customer_reviews.text: The AmazonBasics 60-inch LightWeight Tripod broke within three month of very light use. One of the rivets that holds one of the leg supports in place sheared off. I did not use the tripod very much in three months. You can only return this product for one month. I will have to contact customer service under the one year warranty to see what it will entail to fix this thing. What a pain. I temporarily installed a cotter pin to substitute for the lost rivet. The tripod was fine for three months.
customer_reviews.author: Workenalot

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for the price. I like the levels and ball bearing feet. Everything locks positively into place and eliminates any wiggle. Quick release so you can keep the mount on your camera and slip it on the the tripod very quickly. Carrying case included. It's lightweight and exactly what I was looking for. Even if I only use this a couple times a year it's paid for.
customer_reviews.author: The_Dude

customer_reviews.title: Fits APEMAN NM4 Portable Video DLP Pocket/Mini Projector
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the APEMAN NM4 Portable Video DLP Pocket/Mini Projector which says it has a standard trip pod hole. I was hopeful that this tripod would fit and it did. The tripod itself is fairly easy to adjust. The quality looks good and I love that it comes with a carry case that has a handle. I haven't had it long so not sure how well it will stand up to constant travel to site locations but so far so good. Very light wait which is a must.
customer_reviews.author: WB
